line_1: In vain on Fortune's Aid rely:
Farewell, my love! O still on heaven rely,
line_2: I can no more, I tremble, faint and die!

line_1: "That fools alone on future worlds rely,
line_2: " And all who die for faith, deserve to die. "

line_1: On which her hopes with confidence rely;
line_2: He points where hidden danger they should fly,

line_1: Why, fair One, would You not rely
At length on their united strength rely,
line_2: They rouse the seamen, who half slumbering lie,

line_1: On whom for needful succour I rely
line_2: Let me (and may that God to whom I fly,

line_1: Bids thee on his love rely,
But would You meanly thus rely
We safely on your Dictates may rely.
line_2: Thou great Directress of our Minds, said I,

line_1: On His sure Virtue long let Earth rely:
line_2: And late let the Imperial Eagle fly,

line_1: On His sure Virtue long let Earth rely:
line_2: To bear the Hero thro' His Father's Sky,

line_1: " Who on thy counsel and thy craft rely;
line_2: "Thee, too, my child, those fools as Cunning fly,

line_1: And while on public nurs'ries they rely,
line_2: Not knowing, and too oft not caring why,

line_1: Never (he calls) on Fortune's faith rely,
line_2: Nor grasp her dubious gifts as property.

line_1: On this vain hope adulterers, thieves rely,
line_2: And to this altar vile assassins fly.
